TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BindingsCollection extends System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Simple data binding is accomplished by adding <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> objects to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection>. Any object that inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class can access the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection> through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DataBindings%2A> property. For a list of Windows controls that support data binding, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> class.
## Examples The following example binds the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control to a field in a database.
[!code-cpp[Classic BindingsCollection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic BindingsCollection Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic BindingsCollection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic BindingsCollection Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic BindingsCollection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic BindingsCollection Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event CollectionChanged As CollectionChangeEventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when the collection has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection.CollectionChanged> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection> named `BindingsCollection1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection.CollectionChanged> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#126](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#126)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#126](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#126)]

remarks.format:

In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection.CollectionChanging> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example prints the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo.BindingMember%2A> value of each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> in a control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection>.
[!code-cpp[Classic BindingsCollection.this Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic BindingsCollection.this Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic BindingsCollection.this Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic BindingsCollection.this Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic BindingsCollection.this Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic BindingsCollection.this Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCollectionChanged(class System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs ccevent) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnCollectionChanged (ccevent As CollectionChangeEventArgs)
abstract member OnCollectionChanged : System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs -> unit override this.OnCollectionChanged : System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection.OnCollectionChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method so that registered delegates receive the event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCollectionChanging(class System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnCollectionChanging (e As CollectionChangeEventArgs)

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection.CollectionChanging> event occurs when the event is about to change.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection.OnCollectionChanging%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method so that registered delegates receive the event.
